meanings.sent1: The heavy metal had a leady appearance.
meanings.sent2: The pencil felt leady in my hand.
meanings.sent3: The cake had a leady taste due to the metal pan.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had a leady quality, deep and solid.
meanings.sent5: The sky turned a leady gray before the storm.

meanings.definition: Showing the characteristics of a leader.
meanings.sent1: His confident demeanor was leady among the group.
meanings.sent2: She displayed a leady attitude during the crisis.
meanings.sent3: The cat took on a leady role, directing the other animals.
meanings.sent4: The tree stood tall and leady in the forest, commanding attention.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's leady presence made the students respect her.

meanings.sent1: She would leady the team to victory with her strategy.
meanings.sent2: The map will leady you to the treasure.
meanings.sent3: The dog tried to leady its owner back home after getting lost.
meanings.sent4: His intuition always leady him in the right direction.
meanings.sent5: The stars in the sky can leady travelers on a dark night.
